title: Tom Brownlee (rugby league)
text:
Thomas Brownlee was a New Zealand professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1910s. He played at representative level for <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> (<a href="List%20of%20New%20Zealand%20Kiwis%20representatives">Heritage № 70</a>), and <a href="Thames%20rugby%20league%20team">Thames</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a> (prior to the specialist positions of; ), during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
International honours.
Brownlee represented <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> in <a href="1912%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20league%20tour%20of%20Australia">1912 on their tour of Australia</a> and also played for Thames. Thames was a sub-league of the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a> at the time.
